results.title: John McCain, War Hero, Senator, Presidential Contender, Dies at 81
results.abstract: A naval aviator who endured torture in Vietnam, Mr. McCain rose to the heights of power in Washington until cancer felled him.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

results.title: John McCain, a Last Lion of the Senate
results.abstract: The Senate becomes a lesser place without the sometimes angry, often funny, always larger-than-life presence of the Republican from Arizona.

results.title: Pope in Ireland: Francis Meets Church Abuse Victims

results.title: In Ireland, Pope Francis Finds a Country Transformed and a Church in Tatters

results.title: Giraffe Parts Sales Are Booming in the U.S., and It’s Legal
results.abstract: An investigation showed imports made into pillows, boots and other items have become increasingly popular, at a time when the animal’s global population is dwindling.

multimedia.copyright: Tristan Spinski for The New York Times

results.title: How ‘Searching’ Uses Tech Devices as Narrative Devices
results.abstract: A thriller that takes place entirely on computer screens and apps required rethinking everything. The filmmakers explain — by text, Google Hangout and other platforms.

multimedia.caption: John Cho in a scene from “Searching.”

results.title: Alex Storm, Who Found a Long-Lost Treasure at Sea, Dies at 80
results.abstract: In 1965, with two partners, he located thousands of coins in the water off Nova Scotia from the wreck of the Chameau in 1725.

multimedia.caption: From left, Alex Storm, Harvey MacLeod and David MacEachern with some of the coins they salvaged from the sunken wreck of the Chameau, an 18th-century French ship, in 1965.

results.title: Amazon Tribe Never Seen by Outsiders Is Spotted by Drone
results.abstract: A Brazilian expedition captured images of the indigenous peoples and their tools, along with an aerial photo of a thatched hut.

multimedia.caption: An aerial view of a thatched hut in Vale do Javari, Amazonas state, Brazil.
